item.title: Zombies of Value: How Good Intentions Kills Ownership
item.author: Alex Carrillo
item.description:
Not all bugs live in codem, some start with people. Recently,a conversation with a friend who’s a Product Manager led me down a different path, one that doesn’t start with an error message or a failing test case, but with something subtler: behavior.

She recommended me the book “What Got You Here Won’t Get You There” by Marshall Goldsmith, and one idea that stood out to me was the concept of “Adding Too Much Value.” It hit close to home because I’ve experienced that, and that perspective has deeply influenced how I show up in a team.

item.title: Yes, it is possible
item.author: Alex Carrillo
item.description: Throughout my career as a Software Engineer, I’ve had the chance to face a wide range of software errors, from isolated cases to full system failures. It’s fascinating to observe how different people take different paths to reach the same destination: the root cause. But I want to talk about a behavior that, unfortunately, I see repeating itself over and over again when trying to find “the needle in the haystack.”
